meanings.definition: The act or process of translating words or text from one language into another.
meanings.sent1: I needed a translation of the book to understand it.
meanings.sent2: The translation of the poem captured the beauty of the original language.
meanings.sent3: The translation of the menu made me laugh because it said 'chicken' instead of 'fish'.
meanings.sent4: Her translation of emotions into words was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The translation of the ancient text brought history to life.

meanings.definition: The written or spoken rendering of the meaning of a word, text, speech, etc. into another language.
meanings.sent1: The translation of the speech was clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard on the translation of the document to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The translation of the joke into English made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His translation of the song lyrics was like poetry in a different language.
meanings.sent5: The translation of the play brought the characters to life on stage.

meanings.definition: The act of changing something from one form or medium into another.
meanings.sent1: The artist's translation of emotions into paintings was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The translation of the story into a movie was a huge success.
meanings.sent3: The translation of the recipe into a healthier version surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her translation of the music into dance moves was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The translation of the idea into a business plan was a smart move.
